page.title: 08Rainhill's railway station.
page.content: Rainhill was the site of locomotive trials held in 1829 to test the possibility of using steam locomotion on the newly built railway between Liverpool and Manchester.Todays station no longer carries inter-city traffic, just local traffic. It has two platforms linked by an iron footbridge. The ticket office has been modernised but the station shares many of the characteristics of small stations elsewhere-apart from morning and evening 'rush hours' there is no permanent staff and passengers have a waiting room with few facilities apart from shelter. British Rail have an increasing policy to oblige passengers to buy tickets on the train rather than at a station office. One platform carries a notice describing the success of Stevenson in 1829.
